title: Be Proactive
summary: Take responsibility for your actions and attitudes instead of blaming others or circumstances.

details.content: Being proactive means you control your reactions and choices, which empowers you to shape your own life rather than letting outside forces dictate your path.
Instead of blaming a bad grade on a teacher, you reflect on your study habits and make a plan to improve.

content: Pause before reacting to difficult situations.
Use proactive language: say 'I can' instead of 'I can't.'
Focus on what you can control, not what you can't.
Take initiative to solve problems.

title: Begin with the End in Mind
summary: Set clear goals and envision your future to guide your daily actions.

details.content: Having a vision helps you make decisions that align with your values and long-term objectives, preventing you from drifting aimlessly.
You want to become a doctor, so you prioritize science classes and volunteer at a hospital.

content: Write a personal mission statement.
Set short-term and long-term goals.
Visualize your ideal future regularly.
Check if your daily actions align with your goals.

title: Put First Things First
summary: Prioritize important tasks over less urgent distractions to manage your time effectively.

details.content: Focusing on what matters most helps you achieve your goals and reduces stress from last-minute rushing.
You finish your homework before playing video games, ensuring you meet deadlines and have time to relax.

content: Use a planner to schedule important tasks.
Identify your most important priorities each day.
Say no to distractions that don't align with your goals.
Break big tasks into smaller, manageable steps.

title: Think Win-Win
summary: Seek solutions that benefit everyone involved, rather than competing or compromising.

details.content: Win-win thinking builds trust and strengthens relationships, making it easier to work with others and resolve conflicts.
You and a friend both want to use the computer, so you agree to take turns instead of arguing.

content: Look for solutions where everyone gains.
Avoid thinking in terms of winners and losers.
Celebrate others' successes.
Communicate openly and honestly.

title: Seek First to Understand, Then to Be Understood
summary: Listen actively to others before expressing your own viewpoint.

details.content: Understanding others' perspectives builds empathy and trust, making it easier to resolve disagreements and collaborate.
When a friend is upset, you listen carefully to their feelings before offering advice or sharing your own opinion.

content: Listen without interrupting.
Ask clarifying questions.
Restate what you heard to confirm understanding.
Hold off on giving advice until the other person feels heard.

title: Synergize
summary: Work together with others to achieve more than you could alone by valuing differences and combining strengths.

details.content: Synergy allows teams to create better solutions by leveraging diverse perspectives and talents.
In a group project, you divide tasks based on each person's strengths, resulting in a higher-quality outcome.

content: Value differences in others.
Encourage open collaboration.
Be willing to compromise and build on others' ideas.
Look for creative solutions that combine everyone's input.

title: Sharpen the Saw
summary: Renew yourself regularly in body, mind, heart, and spirit to maintain balance and effectiveness.

details.content: Regular self-renewal prevents burnout and keeps you energized, focused, and resilient.
You schedule time each week for exercise, reading, spending time with friends, and reflecting on your goals.

content: Exercise and eat healthy.
Read, learn, and challenge your mind.
Build positive relationships.
Take time for reflection, meditation, or spiritual practices.
